definition: open ball (math.)/to start a ball game/to kick off (soccer)/to tee off (golf)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The team captains exchanged civilities before the kickoff.
sentences.chinese: 两队的队长在开球之前互相客套了一番。

sentences.english: Jack duffed his drive off the first tee.
sentences.chinese: 杰克开球第一杆就未击中球。

sentences.english: They look enterprising from the first minute of the kick-off.
sentences.chinese: 从开球的第一分钟起他们就显得很有进取心。

sentences.english: He duffed his drive off the first tee.
sentences.chinese: 他开球第一杆就未击中。

sentences.english: The players eventually teed off two hours late.
sentences.chinese: 推迟两个小时之后，运动员终于开球了。

sentences.english: Players must report to the starter at least 15 minutes before their tee-off time.
sentences.chinese: 选手必须至少在开球前15分钟向出发站报到。

sentences.english: The first goal came just 2 minute after the kick-off.
sentences.chinese: 开球以后2分钟就进了第一个球。
最早的开球时间是什么时候？

sentences.english: Teeing off in the wide open spaces is a great release from the pressures of city life.
sentences.chinese: 在宽阔的地方开球，很能消除城市生活的压力。

sentences.english: You need to be a good distributor of the ball and Pepe certainly has that ability.
sentences.chinese: 你得成为一个良好的开球者，而佩佩绝对用这种能力。

sentences.english: Wenger will not take any risks at the KC Stadium in Saturday's late kick-off.
sentences.chinese: 温格不愿意在周六这场延迟开球的比赛中冒任何风险。

sentences.english: Keep quiet while other players are making the tee-shot.
sentences.chinese: 当别的球手在开球时，请您保持安静。

sentences.english: He teed the ball up carefully and then teed off.
sentences.chinese: 他把球小心地放在球座上，然后开球。

sentences.english: The game would start at 1pm when he would hear "Play ball."
sentences.chinese: 一声“开球”，比赛将在下午一点开播。

sentences.english: All robots must be located on their own side of the field.
sentences.chinese: 开球时，所有的机器人必须位于属于自己的半场。

sentences.english: The referee tossed a coin to decide which team should kick off.
sentences.chinese: 裁判掷硬币以决定哪个队开球。

definition: club (golf)/cue (billiards)/also written 球桿|球杆[qiu2 gan1]
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to serve the ball/to tee off
